reviewText: I was stationed onboard the USS Point Cruz CVE-119 for two years just prior to the incidence of the baby adoption.  This was originally a NBC movie of the week I believe, called "1000 Men and a Baby".  The story is true and although I was no longer aboard, I knew many of the men who were.  I was an Aerographer's Mate Third Class then.  The crew of the Point Cruz have a reunion each year and the baby, who is now a grown man, usually attends these meetings.  This movie is hard to find on DVD and I was lucky to have found this one.  It is in excellent condition.  The movie is a heart-warming story.
summary: I was stationed onboard this ship
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: I have been looking for this movie for years. I always thought it was called "Thousand Men and a Baby".  Why do they change the names and not cross reference them?This is one of my favorites.  Richard Thomas & Gerald McRaney are wonderful in this, and the actor who plays the Navy Chaplin (sorry I can't remember his name)is great.  This is a truly heartwarming story and I wish we had more these days.
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: I've been wanting to add this title to our DVD collection for quite some time.  When it was originally aired on TV, it was entitled, "A Thousand Men and a Baby".  This is a terrific true story of how one man, even a whole shipful of navy men worked tirelessly to find a home for an American/Korean orphan.  Heartwarming!  Highly recommended!
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: This story is very touching and sad at the same time.  I feel it projects the era of time very well .  I will watch it over and over again.
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: I first saw this movie years ago on TV, then taped it -- as "A Thousand Men and a Baby."  After literally years of searching for the DVD, I FINALLY located it under this title.  My mother watched the DVD with me and she loves the movie, too.
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: I first saw this movie on TV under the title "A Thousand Men and A Baby. I thought it was one of the best movies I ever saw.
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: What a great movie. I first saw it on TV when it was called "A Thousand Men and a Baby" and I loved it. I just had to have a pro copy.I wish everyone would see this movie. It was based on a true story.
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: This is the true story of a child born during the Korean conflict who was part Korean and part American.  As a result the Koreans would have destroyed the child if it wasn't for the intervention of an American Naval Doctor who brought him aboard an aircraft carrier and "Danny" was adoped by 1,000 men.  They made clothes for him, a crib for him and how they got the papers to get him to the US so he could be adopted is just a great story.  The story also follows Danny's life and a reunion of the men on the aircraft carrier.  Just a wonderful heartwarming story that is true and shows a different side of the Korean conflict.
summary: A THOUSAND MEN AND A BABY
Title: Narrow Escape

reviewText: It was nice to see Richard Thomas in a non "Waltons" role.  Overall it was a sweet story and a good movie.
Title: Narrow Escape
